Title: Maulid: Ansar-Ud-Deen urges Muslims to emulate Prophet Muhammad’s virtues
Summary: Ansar-Ud-Deen Society of Nigeria urges Muslims to emulate Prophet Muhammad’s virtues . President of the group, Prince Mosediq Kazeem (SAN), in his Maulid Nabiyy message, urged Muslims to reflect on the life of Prophet Muhammad .

Title: Cross River First Lady empowers over 500 with technical, vocational skills
Summary: Cross River First Lady, Dr. Eyoanwan Otu, through her foundation, Humanity Without Borders (HUWIB), has trained and empowered over 500 women, men, and youths across the state in various vocational and technical skills .

Title: Taraba govt launches electronic medical records, database for health workers
Summary: Gov. Agbu Kefas launched the Electronic Medical Records for Secondary Healthcare Facilities (EMR4SHF) and the Human Resources for Health (HRH) Database as part of efforts to modernise the state’s healthcare system .

Title: Nigerian Muslims hold prayers, lectures, solidarity march for Gaza
Summary: Thousands of Muslim faithful and pro-Palestine advocates gathered at the Da’wah Centre, Apapa–Oshodi Expressway, Ijesha, Lagos, to mark Aqsa Day 2025 .

Title: C’River CoS hails Gov Otu’s appointment as APC campaign chairman in Anambra
Summary: C’River CoS hails Gov Otu’s appointment as APC campaign chairman in Anambra State . Dr. Emmanuel Ironbar congratulated Governor Bassey Otu on his appointment .

Title: No Ebola case in Nigeria, says NCDC
Summary: Surveillance has been heightened, especially at borders and points of entry . Although no case has been reported in Nigeria, the NCDC said surveillance was heightened .

Title: Southern Kaduna crisis political, not religious — Muslim coalition
Summary: The Coalition of Muslim Ummah of Southern Kaduna has cautioned against framing the recurring crises in the area as religious . The coalition insists that the conflicts are political in nature and not driven by faith .

Title: Owo Massacre: We’ll ensure justice for victims, Aiyedatiwa vows
Summary: Ondo State Governor, Lucky Aiyedatiwa, vows that his administration will not relent in pursuit of justice for victims of the June 5, 2022 terrorist attack on St. Francis Catholic Church, Owo, where over 40 worshippers were killed .

Title: Guns alone won’t solve insecurity problem — Uba Sani
Summary: If you travel to Zamfara, Birnin Gwari or the forests of Katsina, you can go for about 50 kilometres without meeting a single policeman .

Title: Just in: Rhodes-Vivour joins ADC in Lagos
Summary: Mr. Gbadebo Rhodes-Vivour formally joined the African Democratic Congress (ADC) The declaration, held in Alimosho Local Government Area of Lagos, was nearly . The 2023 governorship candidate of the Labour Party (LP) in Lagos State .

Title: Abducted Kogi monarch regains freedom
Summary: The District Head of Bagaji Odo in Omala Local Government Area of Kogi State, David Akpa, was abducted last Monday . The monarch was rescued following the combined efforts of security agencies, hunters, and vigilante groups, coordinated by the council chairman .

Title: Police arrest nine over mob attack on station in Kano
Summary: The Kano State Police Command has arrested nine suspects in connection with a violent mob attack on the Garko Police Division following the arrest of three men linked to an alleged culpable homicide case . An angry crowd armed with sticks and stones stormed the Division, protesting the death of a victim in the case and attempting to lynch the suspects

Title: NAF airstrikes kill over 30 terrorists in Borno
Summary: The Nigerian Air Force said it has neutralised more than 30 terrorists in a joint operation with ground troops in Borno State . The operation took place on September 5, 2025, at Dar-El-Jamal village in Bama Local Government Area, following reports of heavy engagements between terrorists and friendly forces .

Title: UNIZIK staffer caught in N400,000 admission scam
Summary: The Acting Vice-Chancellor of Nnamdi Azikiwe University, Awka, Prof. Carol Chinyelugo Arinze-Umobi, has cracked down on admission racketeering in the institution . Nnaji Kenneth, a staff member of the Personnel Unit(Statistics) in the Registry Department, was alleged to

Title: Tackle age cheating in youth games, Delta gov urges NSC
Summary: The Delta State Governor, Sheriff Oborevwori, has charged the National Sports Commission to urgently address the growing problem of age cheating at editions of the National Youth Games . He made the call on Saturday at the Stephen Keshi Stadium, Asaba, during the closing ceremony of the 9th edition of the Games .
